str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To look around on, survey. From peri and blepo; to look all around.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!
With difficulty, hardly. Adverb from duskolos; impracticably.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Money, riches, possessions. Something useful or needed, i.e. Wealth, price.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
